abstract.t: The secure anycast tunneling protocol (SATP) defines a protocol used for communication between any combination of unicast and anycast tunnel endpoints. It allows tunneling of every ETHER TYPE protocol (ethernet, ip ...). SATP directly includes cryptography and message authentication based on the methods used by the Secure Real-time Transport Protocol(SRTP) [1]. It can be used as an encrypted alternative to IP Encapsulation within IP [3] and Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) [4]. Both anycast receivers and senders are supported.
